quotes.message: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act.

quotes.message: Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Tell the truth, or someone will tell it for you.
quotes.name: Stephanie Klein

quotes.message: Pretending to be someone you're not is a waste of the person you are.
quotes.name: Kurt Cobain

quotes.message: Everyone sees who I appear to be but only a few know the real me. You only see what i choose to show. There's so much behind my smile you just don't know.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: I'd rather be hated for who I am, rather than loved for who I am not.
quotes.name: Kurt Cobain

quotes.message: Proof is boring. Proof is tiresome. Proof is an irrelevance. People would far rather be handed an easy lie than search for a difficult truth, especially if it suits their own purposes.
quotes.name: Joe Abercrombie

quotes.message: Understanding is a three edged sword: your side, their side, and the truth.
quotes.name: J. Michael Straczynski

quotes.message: Before speaking, consult your inner-truth barometer, and resist the temptation to tell people only what they want to hear.
quotes.name: Wayne W. Dyer

quotes.message: Say what you have to say, not what you ought. Any truth is better than make-believe.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: When one realises one is asleep, at that moment one is already half-awake.
quotes.name: P.D. Ouspensky

quotes.message: Truth only reveals itself when one gives up all preconceived ideas.
quotes.name: Shoseki

quotes.message: Truth, like gold, is to be obtained not by its growth, but by washing away from it all that is not gold.
quotes.name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.message: Truth is the breath of life to human society. It is the food of the immortal spirit. Yet a single word of it may kill a man as suddenly as a drop of prussic acid.
quotes.name: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.message: We swallow greedily any lie that flatters us, but we sip only little by little at a truth we find bitter.
quotes.name: Denis Diderot

quotes.message: We do not err because truth is difficult to see. It is visible at a glance. We err because this is more comfortable.
quotes.name: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

quotes.message: Truth is incontrovertible, malice may attack it and ignorance may deride it, but, in the end, there it is.
quotes.name: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.message: Truth is the secret of eloquence and of virtue, the basis of moral authority; it is the highest summit of art and of life.
quotes.name: Henri Frederic Amiel

quotes.message: Some people think that the truth can be hidden with a little cover-up and decoration. But as time goes by, what is true is revealed, and what is fake fades away.
quotes.name: Ismail Haniyeh

quotes.message: Truth will ultimately prevail where there is pains to bring it to light.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.message: People will generally accept facts as truth only if the facts agree with what they already believe.
quotes.name: Andy Rooney

quotes.message: Nobody speaks the truth when there is something they must have.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Bowen

quotes.message: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.
quotes.name: Flannery O'Connor

quotes.message: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.message: Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.
quotes.name: George R.R. Martin

quotes.message: The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth.
quotes.name: Lao Tzu

quotes.message: People often claim to hunger for truth, but seldom like the taste when it's served up.
quotes.name: George R.R. Martin

quotes.message: The truth doesn't always set you free; people prefer to believe prettier, neatley wrapped lies
quotes.name: Jodi Picoult

quotes.message: Things come apart so easily when they have been held together with lies.
quotes.name: Dorothy Allison

quotes.message: Candor is appreciated and people say that is what they want. However, what they mean is tell me the truth, even if you have to make it up.
quotes.name: Monica L. Wofford

quotes.message: For each truth, the contrary is also true!
quotes.name: Herman Hesse

quotes.message: From Latin: 'Inside man lives the truth.
quotes.name: Saint Augustine

quotes.message: In wartime, truth is so precious that she should always be attended by a bodyguard of lies.
quotes.name: Winston Chuchill

quotes.message: When in doubt, tell the truth.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: I offer my opponents a bargain: if they will stop telling falsehood about us, I will stop telling the truth about them.
quotes.name: Adlai Stevenson

quotes.message: Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Truth is the most valuable thing we have. Let us economize it.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: It is perfectly monstrous.. the way people go about nowadays saying things against one behind one's back that are absolutely and entirely true.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to deliver them.
quotes.name: Galileo Gallilei

quotes.message: Every violation of truth is not only a sort of suicide in the liar, but is a stab at the health off human society.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: The truth, of course, is that a billion falsehoods told a billion times by a billion people are still false.
quotes.name: Travis Walton

quotes.message: Truth can be a dangerous thing. It is quite patient and relentless.
quotes.name: R. Scott Richards

quotes.message: Say not, 'I have found the truth,' but rather, 'I have found a truth.
quotes.name: Khalil Gibran

quotes.message: The truth us what it is, not what should be. What should be is a dirty lie.
quotes.name: Lenny Bruce

quotes.message: Truth is such a rare thing, it is delightful to tell it.
quotes.name: Emily Dickinson

quotes.message: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.
quotes.name: Vladimir Lenin

quotes.message: The third time you say a thing, it sounds like a lie.
quotes.name: Harrison Ford

quotes.message: Truth, like light, blinds. Falsehood, on the contrary, is a beautiful twilight that enhances every object.
quotes.name: Albert Camus

quotes.message: Truth isn't always beauty, but the hunger for it is.
quotes.name: Nadine Gordimer

quotes.message: Chase after the truth like all hell and you'll free yourself, even though you never touch its coattails.
quotes.name: Clarence Darrow

quotes.message: The surest way to remain poor is to be an honest man.
quotes.name: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.message: It is easier to perceive error than to find truth, for the former lies on the surface and is easily seen, while the latter lies in the depth, where few are willing to search for it.
quotes.name: Goethe

quotes.message: They say that in the end truth will triumph, but it's a lie.
quotes.name: Anton Chekhov

quotes.message: Verily there is nothing so false, that a sparkle of truth is not in it.
quotes.name: Tupper's Proverbial Philosophy

quotes.message: Truth is powerful and it prevails.
quotes.name: Sojourner Truth

quotes.message: Have the courage to say no. Have the courage to face the truth. Do the right thing because it is right. These are the magic keys to living your life with integrity.
quotes.name: W. Clement Stone

quotes.message: Truth is timeless. Truth does not differ for one age to another, from one people to another, from one geographical location to another... the great all-prevailing truth stands for time and eternity.
quotes.name: Billy Graham

quotes.message: Because truth is unpopular does not mean that is should not be proclaimed.
quotes.name: Billy Graham

quotes.message: I have met men who are habitual liars. They have lied so long that they no longer can distinguish between the truth and a lie. Their sensitivity to sin has been almost completely dead end.
quotes.name: Billy Graham

quotes.message: Our emotions can lie to us, and we need to counter our emotions with truth.
quotes.name: Billy Graham

quotes.message: The truth slips and turns. The facts remain the same.
quotes.name: Joshua Brand
